		Question: what was f. scott fitzgerald
		Answer:
answer: F. Scott Fitzgerald was a notable American novelist and short story writer, widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century. He is best known for his novels "This Side of Paradise" (1920) and "The Great Gatsby" (1925), which are considered classics of American literature. Fitzgerald was also influenced by the literary critic Edmund Wilson.
